comment: Great professor! His classes are well-structured, with quizzes and writing assignments that are straightforward. Lectures can be sped up, and Unstuck ai was super helpful for study prep. Easy A.

This guy is amazing. his class is very organized and straight forward. each week you have 1 lecture quiz & 1 reading quiz which are very easy. 2 one page writing and tests. he is very nice and easy going. i took all his quizzes with just listening to his lecture videos 2x speed before taking the quizzes and got a 100 on almost all.
I didn't watch a lot of the lectures, but the class was relatively easy without them. He's an easy GPA boost.
He is a great professor! Take him if you can, he is so sweet and is very passionate about history. His lectures are long but contain everything you need to know.

Lots of work, but it's all easy. The hardest thing is getting through the 1-3 hours of lecture per week but it's not too bad at 2x speed. All tests/quizzes are open note and easy to find answers, and the only thing that's not multiple choice are some short writing assignments, I scored 90% on both. He's flexible and kind, I would take him again.

He is such a great prof and i 100% recommend!! he is so understanding! Tests are on lockdown and follow the lecture quizzes directly. Lectures are pretty slow/boring but they will help you!! there are reading assignments used with the textbook. you also have 3 writing assignments and critcal thinking quizzes. This class was an easy A
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Victor was so awesome his red shirt is too :D. Really cool prof and I loved his class.
He was the best professor i've ever had

His powerpoints are useless, and the questions on his test are word for word what he says in the lecture, so if you're not paying attention, you're going to have a tough time. I took his class online and could skip around in videos, but I can't imagine having him in person. His critical thinking quizzes were very poorly worded which made them hard.

solid online choice. i am not a history person, but his class was not too bad. you can tell he is very passionate about history. his lecture recordings were so long sometimes. i didn't really watch all of them, i would just do the assignments and my grade is good right now. no lockdown. everything is on launchpad.

NO LOCKDOWN but his PowerPoints had barely anything on them so as someone who is a visual learner, his lectures were really hard to retain information from. I ended up not even watching them and just reading the book and doing the assignments. Still made an A so overall easy and he isn't a tough grader, but personally would not take him again.
Excellent professor! He knows the content well and explains the story of history in an exciting way! He is willing to work with students to help them succeed! I would definitely recommend!

A nice and fun guy. He wants you to learn about history and enjoy the class. Remember to stay focused during the lectures because a lot of what he says in class will be on the test, so take lots of notes, review the PowerPoint, and study the weekly quizzes. Critical thinking and Tests are worth a lot and there are weekly quizzes. No lockdown.

HIST 1111: Said he would take attendance but didn't. Great story-teller in class so I didn't even have to take notes. Non-lockdown browser tests. Online textbook and reading hw assignments. Made usually boring subjects exciting.

Professor Reesor did a great job at laying out the material in an easily accessible format. Attendance was not mandatory and everything needed was online, so I did not attend class. I'm sure that if i would have attended lectures I would have gotten a better grade, but regardless he was a great professor. Replied quickly to emails also.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This class was okay, I stopped going after a month though. Everything he taught was accessible to us online. The quizzes and tests were okay. He seemed like a good professor that taught well, I just always found it boring, but that's because I'm not a fan of history.

Professor Reesor is a hilarious guy and loves to teach by telling stories. The only thing is some days it would be a good engaging class and others would be incredibly boring. There were quizzes and smartbook assignments we had to do along with a few tests. He told us he would be taking attendance but stopped after the second day.

Victor Reesor is an extremely sweet and caring professor, you can tell that he really cares and is passionate about the material. Just be sure to go to the class because most assignments are based off of what he said in the lectures. I would definitely take him again!

My poor rating is based upon his tendency to insert his own political and religious ideas into discussions of history. It feels as though he can't go a single lecture without saying something like "Climate change is nothing new" or that it is dangerous and harmful to have doubts about religious faith. Everything else about the class was manageable.
Honestly seems like an amazing person and is so enthusiastic about his class. He is so sweet and I love his class.
For the most part the class wasn't hard I struggled on some quizzes, but take his class you'll pass.

he gets overwhelmed bc he has a lotttt of students and it shows. but he is so sweet but id say he's not used to having a lot of students and bc of it, he's unorganized. but his unorganization made him cancel a few things and push pack a lot of dates. so I honestly didn't mind. he uses a program called launchpad and there's quizlets for everything.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Best professor I've had so far! He was great, so accessible, caring, funny, and lenient. Everything was done through Launchpad. Do go to the lectures and take good notes because most quiz and exam questions were based on info from lectures. Plus, the lectures are so interesting. There were no extra credit or make ups. Easy class though!

Professor Reesor was a great teacher. He tries his best to make the lectures interesting. He tells it like a story and puts a lot of jokes in there, and he tries to find a current story to relate the topic to so students remember it better. I had an issue come up, and when I emailed him, he was super helpful and understanding. Take him!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: AMAZING prof. Very engaging lectures (non-mandatory). Just take good notes and you'll be fine, the tests and quizzes are both based on the lectures so decent notes are a must. The only other graded assignments are the reading assignments, which are literally impossible to fail.

Overall a great teacher. As long as you take good notes during the lectures you will be okay. A few short assignments per week that were easy to complete and 4 multiple choice tests. The tests take some effort but they're not too bad.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Cool professor. Very understanding
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Amazing teacher who is passionate about History. Has a lot of homework(Reading assignments,Quizzes) that can only be accessed through a website that you have to pay for. Most of his tests are based off his lectures, if you can go to class and listen it shouldn't be too difficult of a class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I got a B but that's because I'm dumb. If you do more than the bare minimum you will get an A. The class is very easy and Professor Reesor is a super super nice guy. He tends to get slightly disorganized from time to time but he will always straighten everything out. TAKE THIS CLASS! Slightly boring lectures but that's okay.

took him online/ in person because of covid. the lectures i went too were good he is funny and friendly. easy A if you take lots of notes / write everything down from his lecture powerpoints. if you dont do well on the tests then there are other assignments that you will make 100s on to make up for it
Cool guy and straightforward class. Show up to the lectures or watch them online and you'll pass no problem.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Honestly one of the easier history classes. The lectures every week range from 1-2 hours but if you take notes then you will pass the quizzes and tests (they are open note). Writing assignments are easy if you took notes in class. The only other work he gives are reading assignments which can be easily found in the textbook. Not a tough grader

Lot of reading and quizzes each week. Our class meets M,W,TH but he split it up so we only go once a week. His lectures are LONG, and some test questions are from his in class lectures. He is a really nice guy, would take this class again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Really chilled & Understanding at times, The essays are kinda tough but it pays off

Reesor was a great professor! We had a reading quiz and a summative quiz every week, which sounds pretty hard but it really isn't. The questions from those quizzes were straight out of the textbook! There were 4 exams including the final. The exams were mini critical thinking essays that were based off of the class lectures. Easy A.

Prof Reesor is a kind hearted man who clearly loves history, and teaching it. He has nearly every lecture memorized and makes class like a movie with his story telling. Do reading assignments & quizzes and youll be fine! He has many assignments throughout the semester and drops your lowest quiz. Attend lectures bc the exam is solely from them!

Dr. Reesor was a fantastic teacher. Took him during 2020 Spring Semester. He made you interested in his lectures and had so much passion when lecturing. He would also make jokes here and there. Read the textbook, a lot of test info comes from the textbook. It's a shame class transitioned to online due to the pandemic. I highly recommend him.

He is an amazing dude but the amount of work I had to do for an A was a little ridiculous. You have a reading assignment and quiz every week and they were annoying. Tests are easy, he drops the lowest except the final. The lectures bored me but I have history anyways. I had him during Corona so that wasn't much help. Overall easy class just boring.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: One of the best teachers I've ever had. Very understanding with late work and missed assignments. Class is mostly lecture based and test questions are taken from notes. He gives amazing lectures and you can tell he cares about what he is talking about. He drops one 0 from each grading category at end of semester. Professor Reesor was great!

I feel bad giving him such a bad rating because he's such a nice man but the workload was ridiculous. So disorganized, and there are several reading assignments and a quiz every week. Easily the hardest class I've ever taken. I studied for 10 hours and wrote extensive notes for one of the tests and got a 57. This is the only C I've gotten in colleg
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Reesor is the kindest soul. He is very accommodating and is willing to help in any way that he can. There are 3 tests, a midterm, and final exam that are all based on lecture not the textbook. He also is willing to boost your grade if you show up to class so it pays to go. Tests weren't bad as long as you pay attention and take good notes.
Best History Professor i have ever had. 4 tests including final and 1 paper. SO EASy. tests are super simple

Professor Reesor is a GREAT professor for history! Work is all on launchpad. Weekly reading assignments with quizzes, 3 writing assignments, 3 exams I believe. He is an easy grader and assignments are SO EASY, just complete them and stay on track! You can tell he loves what he does. He is the best history professor at KSU no doubt

Tests are based off his lectures so studying the power points won't do much. There is a lot of homework that involves reading. You just have to go to class and actually listen. Studying is critical. There are critical assignments and one essay. He gives extra credit at the end if showed up to every class. He drops the lowest grade of each section
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Tests are only what is said in class but there are quizzes online through the textbook. One essay during the late half of the semester. Quizzes and readings online are easy 100s. Drops the lowest Reading, Quiz, and Test. He loves what he teaches and his lectures are funny and inspirational. He makes jokes in his lectures. Take this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Please take this professor if you get the chance. I was a little skeptical at first,but the class is so easy. There are QUITE some reading assignments, but there are so many that I received C's on two tests and still passed with a high A. I thought it was tedious, but it really pays off in the end! Plus none of the tests are cumulative :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Professor Reesor was pretty cool and funny, but to be honest his lectures were very boring. He does a lot of online work like discussion posts, quizzes and this reading chapter assignment like every week but everything is usually on quizlet. If you have a chance to take him do so. he posts his pwp on d2l and everything is on the tests.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Reading quizzes/assignments due online every week, but those are super easy. The tests were hard in my opinion, but there were only 4 including the final with the lowest one dropped. The other assignments are a good grade booster if you don't do so well. He was a very kind professor though.

Take him!! I've never really been good at or interested in history because the academic approach has always been a series of dates but he teaches it more as a story with everything connected. The assignments are online and SUPER easy and if you take notes (more on what he says instead of just the slides) you almost have word for word test answers.

I really liked this professor, I struggle with history because I don't care about it.. but I passed his class with a B. good professor, funny. the only thing you can expect is the weekly homework online. at first I thought it was hard but once you get the hang of it its super easy. he has a midterm and a final. and critical thinking. recommend.

LOVED his lectures!!! He made history interesting and totally worth going to class. At least 1 online quiz and reading assignment a week (most of the time there were 1) but they weren't hard. His power points weren't that helpful but take notes on what he says. He tests you on what he says but if you pay attention the tests are not hard.

every class you just sit and listen and his power points are horrible, so write down everything he says. lots of online quizzes and readings, but easy A's. tests are hard and there are only two of them
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: SO MUCH WORK TO DO OUTSIDE OF CLASS. Its sometimes easy, sometimes difficult. Once again, its very time consuming. No late work either. There only 2 tests, a midterm and final. Im pretty sure he curves the midterm and final. He is such a nice guy and Id take him again because i got As on my assignments because i put forth the effort and kept up.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Victor is a nice and funny guy but super lecture heavy, class is super boring. Theres homework and a quiz due online every week but the homework is a free 100 for doing it and quiz answers are online if you google. Tests are okay if you study and take notes in class and he gives study guides. Make friends in class so they can sign u in.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class was the worst one Ive ever taken. The gradebook online says one thing but this man will factor in a whole bunch of other things and butcher your grade. Save yourself and dont take this class. Did not learn a thing.
Easy class, all tests are online, the material on the test is given during lectures though so you have to attend class. Easy A.

All grades are online so it's super easy. He's very chill and makes a lot of jokes in class. I barely showed up and got an A. If you do go everyday, he curves your grade if you need it. Final is optional because he drops a test grade which could be your final but you have to show up.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: Mr. Reesor really loves history and it made the class very entertaining. I took this class before with another professor and Reesor is 100% the better professor. Online quizzes and tests are easy if you pay attention in class. I would suggest taking notes because they help a lot when trying to remember the differences in civilizations.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Mr Ressor is a great professor with great sense of humor.
easy test. make a groupme and youll do great, i promise

4 online tests, which are note-heavy and based on what he SAYS and emphasizes in class. You wont do well if you go on his powerpoints alone. Final's in person and super easy. There's online reading assignments that you'll make 100s on, and online quizzes which you can use the book for. Drops lowest grade in every category except the essay. TAKE HIM

Reesor is so passionate about what he does and makes history so much fun. Homework every week but not too hard. One paper, 4 tests, and some geography assignments. Tests are not that hard if you take good notes and pay attention but the final was ridiculously easy. I recommend going to class bc he bumps an 88 to a 90 if you do.

tbh i havent been to this class since the first day and i still manage to have an A. Everything is online so you really dont even need the textbook. 1 easy essay assignment. Really nice guy though. I would take his class again.

Reesor is a great professor. Took him for modern world hist. Buy the access code & that lets you do all the work online which are beyond easy. Tests & quizzes are online at home. Tests come from exactly what he says on the powerpoints & he doesnt post them online so come to class! He tells history in a story so its not as boring & I hate history!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: A lot of work on launchpad, tough grader on critical assignments, overall good teacher

He's seriously so cool. I hate history but he transformed into a way that intrigued me and made me want to know, "What happens next?" If you attend class and take good notes, you will be just fine on tests. He uses Launchpad and you have to keep up with the work on there but it's easy. I wish he taught upper lev History so I could take him again.

In one word, he's amazing. My favorite professor I've had at Kennesaw thus far. He's smart, funny, and makes the lectures interesting and enjoyable. I failed this class my freshman year with a different prof. and re-took it with Reesor and made a 98 in the class. He's awesome, you won't regret taking him

GREAT teacher overall. His lectures are very good and very well taught. All work is online. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it will help out in the end. He uses powerpoints and takes notes in class to make you aware of important information. Easy grader, very funny personality, and he makes class enjoyable. I would take his class again.

Let's put it like this, the only reason I went to class (sometimes) wasn't so I could get an A, it was because his personality and the way he taught this class was incredible. I am truly gonna miss him next semester. 10/10 would recommend.

This class uses LaunchPad which is the most poorly-designed software. The class is easy, but just a ridiculous amount of busywork. Tests can be a bit tricky. You definitely need to read the book before tests. Powerpoints don't help much.

Reesor's a good teacher and you'll have fun while learning but his grading system is a little odd. Your exams make up a huge percentage of your final grade, 50%. The quizzes and exams are online and are right out of the book but you only get one try. I noticed that the final used more of class lecture than the book.

He was a funny guy and he really wanted to help you. He didnt mind if you left early or if you were on your phone the whole time but he was entertaining enough with his jokes so you dont die of boredom. The tests can be difficult but theyre over a span of a couple days with no time limit so you can come back to it whenever which really helps. A+!

Easy- all tests, quizzes, reading assignments online. most of the time there isnt a time limit. Can't google answers b/c they are often made by him and involve thought and the textbook- definitely buy it and read along with assignments (or at least skim until you find ans) extra credit for attendance. If you just put a little effort you will pass.

His class wasn't terrible but if history isn't your strong subject, I would not recommend pro. Reesor. He doesn't really teach. He tells a story. Read the book and stay caught up and you'll get a B. He gives extra credit at the end. Which will help your grade tremendously. I failed 35 tests and still got a B.

Class was okay; posts power-points but they are like outlines. You must come to class to get info for test! Attendance will even help your grade (if borderline). He teaches like a story and tells jokes (lame) every now and then.  The book helped me; I hate history so I couldn't stay focused in class. Show videos every now & then too.
The class seemed to be simple but the test were harder than I expected and no matter how hard I studied my highest grade was a 79

I was originally given an A in World History I at Chattahoochee Tech. Then he lowered it to a B, though I was given an A? He would not allow change of answers on online exams, He just did not seem to be 'FOR the Students' kind of professor.   I was very disappointed with his lowering my grade. I would venture to say, he can be a spiteful.

Nice guy with a lot of charisma. Would make a great actor. Tests are based mostly on lecture and a little on PowerPoint. Take notes and you'll do well but if you don't pay attention you'll not do well. Don't get the latest edition of the book; it is the same as the older edition but one is a hundred bucks and the other is five.

He tries not to go on and on about one topic but he always does. We didn't finish everything on the syllabus. I thought he was a good teacher until the last week in class he offered an optional exam to drop your lowest score which he did not end up doing for me.

By means is prof. reesor a horrible teacher. He makes the class interesting and engages with the class. Attend his lectures, take notes of what his says in class and not  just the powerpoints he goes over. You will need the book for the reading assignments  (don't worry they are not horrible) . Take him he is really great.

Kind & knowledgeable man.  Reading isn't enough bc some material on the test comes from the lectures which are very long. He explains everything like a story so it isn't too boring. Takes attendance every class. Tests were short (like 35 questions) but they were specific like 'Which of these did the Qin Dynasty not discover? Iron, Tools, Clay'

I loved this professor. I did NOT do good in his class at the beginning, like literally has an F... But he cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He helped me study and everything and even emailed me asking how I felt about the test and if I had any questions.
Honestly I've always history but this professor made me love it. Yes you have to take notes, but honestly it's like story time. I would take him again if I could.

Exams are based COMPLETELY on lecture, so as long as you show up and TAKE NOTES you will get A's on all of them. Do not study the book for exams. Online quizzes due weekly that are based on the textbook. Time consuming but easy as long as you have the textbook with you. If you take detailed notes of his lecture you will get an A on everything

Warning his tests are NO longer online. So don''t expect them to be a cake walk. However you can still get an A in this class you just have to work for it now. Take notes from his lectures and match them to his power points and you should do fine.

Its hard to get an A in this class, the tests are very tricky. His tests are based on what he teaches in the class so dont get lost in the textbook. The class is boring but he is a good teacher, but overall the class is not an easy A. You have to pay attention, better still write everything that comes out of his mouth....

Overall, this class is interesting. Professor Reesor's lectures were engaging, and he puts his powerpoints online. The course material is easy to absorb, and the reading assignments are easy. I struggled with the analytical assignments. but they got better as time progressed. I would recommend his class.

Great professor! He is very funny in lectures and keeps it interesting. Although tests were in class, all other assignments were through D2L. Lots of busy work but it's easy. Attendance doesn't seem mandatory but lectures are extremely helpful to attend. He thoroughly explains each section and is knowledgeable of his teachings. Would recommend!
All tests, quizzes and assignments are online. Classes are mainly lectures, he puts up notes online for you to write ahead of time. Easy class, interesting lectures and great course.

all assignments, including tests- online!all quizzes for the semester are open from the beginning. definitely need the textbook for the assignments. good professors, kind of quirky but entertaining. I hate history but this class was better than I anticipated. Takes attendance daily.
He's a great professor! Everything's online including the tests so this class is an easy A!

Everything was online. Although going to class didn't seem mandatory (although he does take attendance)When I did go to class I didn't regret it! His stories were AWESOME! He knows what he is talking about and is able to relate his stories and break them down so that they are understandable! Highly recommended!!!

Awesome teacher and very easy class just as long as you do the work and take decent notes on what he says. There are a good amount of assignments but they are simple and online and his tests are also online. This subject may be boring but he really tries to make it interesting. Take him!!

Tries his best to keep his class interesting, mainly lectures the whole time but provides powerpoints. Lots of online assignments so don't wait until the end to do them. Tests are fairly simple if you read the textbook and take good notes. He usually goes over the test the next class and corrects any mistakes he found.

Summer course, EVERYTHING IS ONLINE. Make sure you read the book and know your material when you're taking the exams! The reading assignments are relatively easy but he writes the exam so it will be difficult. The geography assignments are really easy as long as you find a good map!

Easy class. 5 tests, the last 2 were online. He does word questions weird, but just take good notes and study them! Also study the reading assignments. Don't rely on his power points, there more like an outline. I made an A but that did come with some effort. I attended every class and studied for all the tests. The class was interesting. Take him!

I signed up for his class because of all the positive reviews but they aren't true. NONE of his tests have been online and yes they are weirdly worded. The powerpoints aren't that helpful since they're just a guide and are all over the place. The online stuff is easy because you can use your book, but don't expect an effortless or easy A or B.
Easy A. Take good notes,the lecture PowerPoints are online.

His tests were weirdly worded. Sometimes I understood everything in lecture, but I got questions wrong, because his tests were poorly worded. Also, he sometimes tests you on things he never mentioned in class. Good thing he puts most of his tests online.

Prof. Reesor is probably my favorite professor I've had thus far! He makes a subject that can be very boring (history) and teaches it in a way that engages & interests you. He doesn't force you to memorize dates, he just tests on whether you understand what happened and why. Keep up with the super-easy online reading quizzes & go to class.

Professor Reesor was BEYOND amazing in teaching this course. I would recommend him to ANYONE needing a History 1110 course. He didnt really use to the book directly,you just need it for the reading assignments posted (which are super easy). Since he was sick a lot he put 2 of the exams online. Easy 100.

Professor Reesor has been my favorite professor that I have had at Kennesaw thus far. He's very passionate about what he does and truly knows what he is talking about. Some work, but not a lot. Truly enjoyed listening to him and what he had to say on what were usually dry and boring topics. I strongly recommend.

Great professor who made class interesting and knows what he's talking about. There is a lot of work involved including tests, analytical assignments (papers), geography assignments, and reading assignments. None of them are too difficult, but the workload does add up.

Nice guy, tests are a little dfficult until you get used to it. He takes attendance, however I dont know yet if it affects your grade. If you ask him how to study for the tests, you will do well. He posts powerpoints online as well.

LOVE this professor! He is super nice, knows his stuff and makes history actually interesting. I would take him again and again if I had too. I was actually really bummed that he didn't teach the next history class I had to take. Tests are multiple choice, 1 of 4 dropped. If you read the text (skim it) come to class and pay attention, no problem

He is AWESOME! I hate history with a very strong passion. He made this class fun and interesting. It's one of my favorite classes this semester. You can tell that he loves what he does. If you don't take him, you are CRAZY!
He is a great professor, I learned a lot from him and he made the class fun!llove his class!

FANTASTIC PROFESSOR, explains things really well. Easy, but GREAT TEACHER. He knows a lot about everything and is really into what he does. Test are easy, geo. assignment is easy, and essay is easy. His class is one of those that because you aren't stressing about what to know for the tests, you really learn a lot from what he says.

He is THE BEST teacher at KSU..if you need an easy A take him. All notes, test, quizzes, assignments, and paper are online. Attendance is not needed nor is the book, when you do go to class it kinda helps with the test. I could have made an A in the class, but I missed two of the test. So, keep up with due dates...TAKE HIM!!!!

Take his class (if you can get in - fills up FAST!). Class attendance not mandatory, but it makes online exams way easier. We had 6 online exams, one paper, and a super easy geography assignment. I rarely went to class and still got an A. Plus, he doesn't believe in buying textbooks. Also: Rick Steves videos! Reesor is a college student's dream!

AMAZING. All notes and tests online. No final. One paper, but it is easy. Geography assignments due at the end of the semester which are a piece of cake. Attendence not mandatory. Easiest history class ever. I'd take him again if I could.
Super easy! You don't have to buy a textbook. Gives power points. All tests and assignments are online. You'd really have to suck at and hate history to fail.

Easy A. Take this class, it will be the easiest boost to your GPA you have ever made. Tests  and notes are all online. There is one paper that does not require to be turned in using any kind of format. It helps to go to class to get what he adds to the powerpoints that are online but I would not say attendance is mandatory to get a B.
VERY EASY CLASS! he posts all the power point slides online and tests are online too! I enjoy his lectures(they aren't too boring for a history class). I would take him again if i had the chance! :)

Okay, I hate history with a passion, but loved this class. Reesor is entertaining and usually lets out early. All the exams were online, and there was one paper. Used the Pwpt more than anything, but extra necessary info in lectures. He really loves his subject, and I am tempted to take another history class, just to have him again.

He makes history interesting!! the book helps but he doesn't always encourage you to go by the book but by his powerpoints. Tests are posted online!! so basically tests are objective! If you pay attention during class and take notes, the online tests turn out easy for you. Has a very professional approach i must say! Easy A+!!!

Very nice prof.he only used webct and shows movies that are in detailed about different eras, however gives powerpoints every class and this in my opinion is very boring... but if you want an easy passing grade I definitely recommend him!!! Thumbs Up..
TAKE HIM! If you do the work, its an easy A and you dont have to study!

Lots of online quizzes (so its open book/notes), NO exams, an online paper, and show up to class.  Do well in those areas and its an EASY A.  He's an easy going, humorous prof that just basically story tells every class session so take good notes.  Take him when you have a heavy loaded semester cause his class doesn't require much time as others.
He is such a nice guy. 5 online tests, a paper, and a geography assignment. Very easy! Take him!

Very nice guy! Incredibly easy to work with and seems to enjoy what he is doing. The class was not hard at all, 5 online tests a few online assignments and an essay, very manageable. Definitely easier if you have a few buddies in the class with you. I would absolutely recommend this class to anyone and everyone.

Reesor is one of the best teachers at KSU. He is extremely easy if you come to class and do your work. Make friends in the class...all of the tests are online and open-book. I would suggest taking tests in groups. He is extremely flexible and easy going. He wants to make sure you succeed. I wish more teachers were like him. His class was an easy A.

Awesome professor. Teaches to attract students to the subject. Bring your books because he will occassionally use as a base for small discussion groups especially in a large class. Show up to class and show that you are trying and he'll work with you on the grade part. Loved this class. I wish I could take him for a higher level course this summer!
COOL GUY

I truly enjoyed his class. Prof. Reesor is not only a very nice person and easy to talk, but when he teaches, he actually captures the attention of his students by making his lectures interesting by adding humor. I would recommend Prof. Reesor to anyone who wants to learn about history and have fun at the same time.

I really enjoyed this class. Tests were online, and at times very confusing, but I still ended up with a high B. His lectures are great. He's really nice, helpful, and understanding. He dropped the lowest test grade, ended up not counting attendance for a grade (even though he said he would), and gave us an extra essay that was optional.

Reesor is the best teacher. The class was really easy; we had 6 online tests, about 8 geography assignments that you could take as many times as you want, and one essay. I would advise to take good notes in class and pay attention to what he says. Hes a great teacher, TAKE HIM

He is a nice guy, if a little goofy at times, doesn't mind answering questions and encourages debate. If you don't make an A in this class, you are a moron. Three online, open book tests, two essays and an online geography assignment that can be retried. The only thing I don't like is that attendance is mandatory; this is college, not high school.

Gives weekly "research" assignments- just open your book and fill in the blanks as you read. There are about 3 papers you write too. BUT NO TESTS! Attendance not required but it helps if you go. He lectures like he's telling a story! If history isn't your subject take him. he makes the subject tolerable!!:)

Best teacher ever!! Lectures are "stories" and always interesting.  Class is done by reading assignments and answers, and one essay at the end. No tests... easy A. Attendance is not required and all assignments are turned in on line. I loved him!!!

Amazing teacher. Class is a big debate over your thoughts on the chapter you are reading.  No tests, assignments are super easy as long as you know how to defend your answers. Assignments and Essay are opinionated so no right or wrong, just BACK YOUR ANSWER!  He likes students that participate in class, so read your book.

NO TESTS!! Great class for bad test takers. He gives online assignment that are very thorough but that is your grade in class plus attendance and one essay. He tries to be funny but isn't really. Besides that its boring lecture stuff.

Good instructor. Perfect if you don't mind writing papers/essays. Doesn't issue typical tests. Interesting lectures. He encourages discussion. Is a conservative and likes to bait liberals but he does so with humor and never tries to shut anyone up. If you are sensitive to jokes about women you might want to pick another professor.
This was an interesting class. Instead of taking tests he makes you do a few reading assignments and write papers. You can tell that he enjoys what he is teaching.

Great professor, his class is an easy A or B. Attendance is mandatory, but all of his classes are lectures that really make you think. There are no tests, and there is no final. Instead, there are 4 question-answer assignments from the book, and 3 3-5 page essays. The "final" is 1 of these essays.
INCREDIBLE PROFESSOR!  He makes history so interesting...like a story that you can't wait to hear what happens next.  Grades very fairly and values your opinions.
easy class, great and knowledgeable prof.  online exams, some graded HW assignments. one big group project but not as stressful as it sounds. easy A.

Awesome teacher. Very nice and helpful. Doesn't have a strict attendance policy...even though he does take roll. Three exams and a project...Exams are straight from the slides. I got an A+...highly recommend him.
